alert.note: Alert for Dearborn; Ohio; Switzerland (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 25 at 4:01PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF OHIO, SOUTHEASTERN DEARBORN, NORTHEASTERN SWITZERLAND, BOONE AND EASTERN GALLATIN COUNTIES THROUGH 430 PM EDT... At 401 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located over Patriot, moving north at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph, pea size hail, frequent cloud-to-ground lightning, and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Lightning can cause serious injury or death. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Florence, Villa Hills, Lawrenceburg, Greendale, Aurora, Rising Sun, Oakbrook, Burlington, Union, Shawnee, Wilmington, French, Patriot, Ryle, Idlewild, Big Bone Lick, Waterloo, Steele Bottom, Petersburg and Rabbit Hash. This includes the following Interstates... I-71 in Kentucky between mile markers 67 and 70. I-75 in Kentucky near mile marker 181. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. When thunder roars, go indoors! Do not stay in the open or seek shelter under trees when lightning threatens. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
